de.lmu.ifi.nm.www

Interface INetworkAgent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CiscoAgent

    public interface INetworkAgent
    This interface defines a network agent. A network agent discovers the network topology, sets static routes on network devices and converts a proprietary graph object to an open one (e.g. JGraphT).
    Since:
    October 2, 2013
    Author:
    Dawin Schmidt, dawin.schmidt@lmu.de

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getTopology()
      Discover the network topology.
      boolean setRoute(java.lang.String source, java.lang.String destNet, int destSubnetMask, java.lang.String nextHop, java.lang.String sourceInt)
      Set a static route on a network element.
      void toJGraphT()
      Convert a proprietary topology graph object to a JGraphT graph object.

    • Method Detail

      • getTopology

        void getTopology()
        Discover the network topology. Will be called by the Satellite.

      • setRoute

        boolean setRoute(java.lang.String source,
               java.lang.String destNet,
               int destSubnetMask,
               java.lang.String nextHop,
               java.lang.String sourceInt)
        Set a static route on a network element.
        Parameters:
        source - - The source IP-Address of the network element where to configure the route.
        destNet - - The destination network address.
        destSubnetMask - - The destination subnet mask or prefix.
        nextHop - - The IP-Address of the next hop.
        sourceInt - - The source interface of the network element where to configure the route.
        Returns:
        True or false whether a route has been placed successfully or not.

      • toJGraphT

        void toJGraphT()
        Convert a proprietary topology graph object to a JGraphT graph object.
